injuries.shortComment: Buchanan was placed in protocols Friday.
injuries.longComment: Buchanan agreed to a hardship deal with the Grizzlies on Christmas but has landed in protocols after just 10 minutes of play. It seems possible his deal will expire before he exits protocols.

injuries.shortComment: Pons was placed in the NBA COVID-19 protocols Sunday.
injuries.longComment: Pons was one of three Grizzlies' players to enter the league's health and safety protocols Sunday. The rookie out of Tennessee has appeared in just four games for Memphis this season, as he continues to see the bulk of his time in the G League.

injuries.shortComment: Brooks was placed in the NBA's health and safety protocols Sunday.
injuries.longComment: Brooks, along with De'Anthony Melton and Yves Pons all entered the NBA's health and safety protocols Sunday, bringing the team total up to four. His absence will leave the Grizzlies without their most effective scorer for up to the next 10 days, as Brooks is averaging 19.3 points, 3.4 rebounds, 2.7 assists and 1.2 steals in 29.2 minutes per game. John Konchar should slide into the starting five while Brooks is sidelined.

injuries.shortComment: Culver entered the league's health and safety protocols Thursday.
injuries.longComment: Culver will be unavailable for Thursday's matchup against the Warriors, and it's possible that he's forced to miss more games. It's not yet clear whether he's tested positive for COVID-19, but De'Anthony Melton and Desmond Bane could see a slight uptick in playing time in his absence.

injuries.shortComment: Williams (ankle) was placed into the NBA's Covid protocol Sunday morning, Evan Barnes of The Memphis Commercial Appeal reports.
injuries.longComment: Williams wasn't set to play Sunday anyway due to an ankle injury but has now become the first member of the Grizzlies to enter the league's Covid protocol. The 20-year-old has played once since Nov. 30.

injuries.shortComment: Merrill (ankle) is listed as out for Wednesday's game against the Trail Blazers.
injuries.longComment: Merrill has been sidelined for just under a month with a significant left ankle sprain, an injury he suffered in the closing seconds of a 120-108 win over the Clippers on Nov. 18. The Grizzlies haven't offered up a clear timeline for Merrill's return, so the second-year guard may be week-to-week rather than day-to-day at this stage.
